Class CheckersTextConsole

public class CheckersTextConsole extends Object
CheckersTextConsole contains the console based text ui

  • Method Details

    • begin

      public void begin()
      Announces the beginning of a game.

    • getMode

      public int getMode() throws IllegalArgumentException
      Gets the user input to select 1-Player or 2-Player mode.
      Returns:
      1 for 1-Player, 2 for 2-Player.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when input is invalid.

    • confirmOnePlayerMode

      public void confirmOnePlayerMode()
      Announces that user is playing against computer.

    • displayBoard

      public void displayBoard(Object checkerBoard)
      Displays the current state of the CheckerBoard.
      Parameters:
      checkerBoard - The CheckerBoard to be displayed.

    • requestXMove

      public void requestXMove()
      Prompts player X to input a move

    • requestAnotherXMove

      public void requestAnotherXMove()
      Deprecated.
      Multi-jump functionality removed for 1.1 Prompts player X to input a follow-up move after a jump.

    • requestOMove

      public void requestOMove()
      Prompts player O to input a move

    • requestComputerMove

      public void requestComputerMove()
      Announces that it is the computer's turn.

    • rejectInput

      public void rejectInput()
      Prompt to try again after an invalid input.

    • xWon

      public void xWon()
      Announces a win by player X

    • oWon

      public void oWon()
      Announces a win by player O

    • getMove

      public int[] getMove()
      Gets a move from the user.
      Returns:
      The coordinates of a move.

    • getCoordinates

      public int[] getCoordinates(String input)
      Converts user input to coordinates of a move.
      Parameters:
      input - The user input.
      Returns:
      The coordinates of a move if the input is in a valid format, {0, 0, 0, 0} if it is not.

    • requestAnotherOMove

      public void requestAnotherOMove()
      Deprecated.
      Multi-jump functionality removed for 1.1 Prompts player O to input a follow-up move after a jump.

    • getAnotherMove

      public int[] getAnotherMove(int[] previousCoordinates)
      Deprecated.
      Multi-jump functionality removed for 1.1 Gets a follow-up move from the user.
      Parameters:
      previousCoordinates - The coordinates of the previous move.
      Returns:
      The coordinates of a follow-up move.
